conclusion: Understanding the geometry and setup: point light source on a plane, ball thrown upward from midpoint between light source and wall.
Distance between light source and wall is d, midpoint is at d/2.
Analyzing the motion of the ball: thrown vertically with initial velocity v0.
Vertical position of ball as a function of time: y(t) = v0 t - 1/2 gt^2.
Finding position of the shadow: light ray through ball hits wall, slope is 2y(t)/d.
Equation of line: y = (2y(t)/d)x, shadow at x = d gives y_shadow = 2y(t).
Shadow's vertical position: y_shadow(t) = 2v0 t - gt^2.
Calculating initial velocity of shadow by differentiating y_shadow(t) and evaluating at t = 0.
Final answer: initial velocity of the shadow is 2v0.
